prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately twice the diameter. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation. In the XY plane, draw a circle with a radius of 0.375 and a center at (0.375, 0.375). This will create the top face of the cylinder. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1 units in the positive direction. **Part 2: Cross-shaped Cutout** Create a cross-shaped cutout on the top of the cylindrical object. Create a new coordinate system at (0.19, 0.19, 0) with no rotation. In the XY plane, draw a series of connected lines that form a cross shape. The lines should be drawn as follows: - Line 1: (0, 0.14) to (0, 0.23) - Line 2: (0, 0.23) to (0.14, 0.23) - Line 3: (0.14, 0.23) to (0.14, 0.37) - Line 4: (0.14, 0.37) to (0.23, 0.37) - Line 5: (0.23, 0.37) to (0.23, 0.23) - Line 6: (0.23, 0.23) to (0.37, 0.23) - Line 7: (0.37, 0.23) to (0.37, 0.14) - Line 8: (0.37, 0.14) to (0.23, 0.14) - Line 9: (0.23, 0.14) to (0.23, 0.0) - Line 10: (0.23, 0.0) to (0.14, 0.0) - Line 11: (0.14, 0.0) to (0.14, 0.14) - Line 12: (0.14, 0.14) to (0.0, 0.14) This will create the profile for the cross-shaped cutout. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.37. Subtract the scaled sketch from the cylindrical object, cutting away the material in the shape of the cross. The resulting object should be a cylindrical object with a flat top and a cross-shaped cutout in the center of the top. The height of the cylinder is approximately twice the diameter, and the cutout is approximately one-third the diameter in size.</description>
